title: Orange/Yellow primary theme + Blue secondary + Green accent + Gradient primary CTA buttons

requirements.summary: Update global Tailwind/shadcn theme tokens to the requested orange/yellow primary, blue secondary, green accent, and light background with readable foregrounds.
acceptanceCriteria: Global theme variables used by Tailwind/shadcn (e.g., --background/--foreground/--primary/--secondary/--accent and their *-foreground counterparts) reflect the requested palette in the active (light) theme.
All major surfaces (page background, cards/popovers, nav bars) render on a light grey/white background without low-contrast text.
Secondary UI elements that previously used the old secondary color now render as blue (e.g., secondary badges/buttons/links where applicable).
Accent UI elements that previously used the old accent color now render as green (e.g., highlights/success-like accents where applicable).

file_operations.description: Update the light theme CSS variables for --background/--foreground/--card/--popover plus --primary/--secondary/--accent (and their *-foreground counterparts) to match: Primary=orange/yellow, Secondary=blue, Accent=green, Background=light grey/white. Ensure the chosen *-foreground values maintain readable contrast on each surface; keep ring/border/muted tokens coherent with the new palette. (Do not edit any files under frontend/src/components/ui.)

Adjust supporting tokens that surface the palette in common UI (e.g., --ring, --success, and chart tokens if used for admin analytics) so they align with the updated primary/secondary/accent colors while preserving legibility on the light background.

requirements.summary: Create and apply a consistent orange→yellow gradient primary CTA button style across the app via wrappers/composition (without modifying shadcn/ui sources).
acceptanceCriteria: Primary CTA buttons render with a visible orange→yellow gradient and appropriate hover/active/focus states.
Gradient CTA buttons have readable text (e.g., white or high-contrast foreground) and a clear focus ring consistent with the updated theme.

No direct edits are made inside the immutable UI component directory (frontend/src/components/ui); gradient styling is applied via composition, utility classes, or wrapper components and then used throughout the app.
Buttons that represent destructive actions (delete/remove/cancel) do not use the orange→yellow gradient and continue to use a destructive styling.

file_operations.description: Add a reusable gradient CTA utility (e.g., a class in an appropriate Tailwind layer) that applies an orange→yellow left-to-right gradient, readable foreground text, and consistent hover/active/focus-visible ring styles aligned with the updated theme. (Do not edit any files under frontend/src/components/ui.)

Create a small wrapper component around the existing shadcn Button that composes the gradient CTA utility class for primary call-to-action usage while still allowing standard props/className overrides. This must not modify frontend/src/components/ui sources.

Replace primary CTA usage for product actions (e.g., the 'Add to Cart' button) to use the new PrimaryCtaButton wrapper so CTAs render with the orange→yellow gradient. Keep non-primary actions (e.g., wishlist icon, destructive states) using their existing variants.

Apply PrimaryCtaButton to the main cart CTA (e.g., 'Proceed to Checkout') and any other primary navigation CTAs on this page, while leaving destructive actions (e.g., remove item) on destructive/ghost styling.
Apply PrimaryCtaButton to the main checkout CTA (e.g., 'Place Order'), ensuring loading/disabled states preserve readability and the focus ring remains visible.

Apply PrimaryCtaButton to the page’s main purchase CTA (e.g., 'Add to Cart') and to other primary submission actions if applicable (e.g., 'Submit Review' if treated as a primary CTA), while keeping secondary/outline buttons (e.g., carousel controls, wishlist) non-gradient.
Apply PrimaryCtaButton to the profile setup submission CTA (e.g., 'Create Profile') to ensure consistent gradient styling for primary actions. Ensure all user-facing text remains English.
Apply PrimaryCtaButton to the profile save CTA (e.g., 'Save Changes') to ensure consistent gradient styling for primary actions. Ensure all user-facing text remains English.

Apply PrimaryCtaButton to admin product primary CTAs (e.g., 'Add Product', 'Update Product' submit button), while ensuring destructive actions (e.g., 'Delete') remain destructive and non-gradient. Ensure all user-facing text remains English.

Apply PrimaryCtaButton to vendor product primary CTAs (e.g., 'Add Product', 'Update Product' submit button), while ensuring destructive actions remain destructive and non-gradient. Ensure all user-facing text remains English.
Apply PrimaryCtaButton to the admin 'Add Vendor' submission CTA while keeping 'Remove Vendor' destructive styling unchanged and non-gradient. Ensure all user-facing text remains English.
Apply PrimaryCtaButton to the vendor dashboard’s primary navigation CTA (e.g., 'Manage Products') while leaving secondary actions (e.g., outline 'View Orders') as non-gradient.

Ensure login/logout button styling remains appropriate under the new theme. If the unauthenticated state is treated as a primary CTA in this app, switch it to PrimaryCtaButton; otherwise keep it as a standard shadcn Button variant while maintaining English-only text.
